definition: when things come to a head (idiom)
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: If you don't anticipate what may happen, you'll find yourself at a loss when sth. crops up.
sentences.chinese: 你如果沒有思想準備，事到臨頭就會抓瞎。

sentences.english: Try not to think actively about the task before it actually happens.
sentences.chinese: 除非事到臨頭，否則不要提前想着它。

sentences.english: They deal with an issue as and when it rears its head.
sentences.chinese: 事到臨頭他們纔會開始處理。
